024d3b57f618e912.voiceContent: For as long as I can remember, I've been accustomed to handling various matters myself...

05bc9f90331132ce.voiceContent: I've never visited a place filled with such vitality and happiness...

06dd5f69a37e6fe4.voiceContent: Nothing in particular. I just thought it would be nice to have a companion.

06e693a1dd933e70.voiceContent: Heh, either way, I'm not here to twist your arm. You needn't worry.

07c4ed4f72217528.voiceContent: I do, but if I ask, then you must reply.

094fab9655094ab6.voiceContent: There is no rush, we can discuss it further when we have some ideas to share.

16c9cd2b76b78b43.voiceContent: Was this an accidental achievement on your part? Or have you studied the art of war in great depth?

1db8fc88a3a42cba.voiceContent: I suppose I have grown accustomed to spending most of my time in solitude. I seldom have the opportunity to speak with others, so perhaps it'd be better for you to start and I answer.

238df981a64d5de9.voiceContent: But growing up without a companion is not a pleasant experience... Everyone is the same in this regard — pets, people, even tengu.

24b71d9350ce07e3.voiceContent: If I were to keep a pet here, I would certainly need to consult you first. What kind of pet do you think would be best?

35072d7096a1436f.voiceContent: The commission is a whirlwind of people and unexpected complications, so I often relish opportunities to get away for assignments in the field.

3a68cea0a671c697.voiceContent: However, there are many subtleties in communication, it is difficult to grasp in such a short time.

3ef8bab253d6edb1.voiceContent: *sigh* It's difficult to converse with me, isn't it?

4870fb0b521f8be4.voiceContent: Interesting. Your expression reminds me of my subordinates when they are giving a report.

49398e62e50cfdd3.voiceContent: In that case, I select you as my training partner! You can come talk to me as often as you like. Is that alright?

4f10da95aacc1e3a.voiceContent: I have already completed five sets of bow exercises. If you are up to it, I would not mind accompanying you for another five.

5554705577553284.voiceContent: If mastering conversation is akin to the skill of archery, then I am confident I can improve with more practice.

55ea3380f9ab612c.voiceContent: Though it is not as extensive as the Kujou Clan's estate, I find it comfortable enough.

58541b757122cf02.voiceContent: However, because this is a matter between the two of us, you must also hold up your end of the bargain.

5fa8fa3832c96fc3.voiceContent: I have not yet mentioned any specifics and you already agree so readily?

60d5c50a257c4b62.voiceContent: Huh. This place seems in good order.

69645f8ac3030423.voiceContent: A cat? How could I tell whether it's in a good or bad mood?

6ac92f6fece210fa.voiceContent: If we ever need to expand the Kujou Clan residence, I'll be sure to find you.

6c7e90c2b5ff0211.voiceContent: #If there's nothing else, then... good night, {NICKNAME}.

72503b34e6883bef.voiceContent: If you fail to do so, then you will receive the due punishment. Have you made up your mind?

75a7d64c90998122.voiceContent: Impressive. This courtyard is every bit as striking as the headquarters of the Tenryou Commission.

76d0ba5e3b19bef4.voiceContent: I must commend you for your insight in having discerned this principle.

771e6b9a58eaea9a.voiceContent: I know! How about a Red Horned Lizard? It's a solitary creature and doesn't require much interaction.

77be1a90d209f1bd.voiceContent: Seeing as I have nothing better to do, I'll comply.

7993d99f21559019.voiceContent: Oh, but first and foremost, we must come up with a memorable name for our pet.

877a0187efb15dd7.voiceContent: In fact, there is little that can be changed about the Kujou Clan residence. I mean, it would never become a place like this, at least.

88d09961604be675.voiceContent: Though I once did have the thought of raising pets, due to various circumstances, I was never able to...

a6ebb1a2d7e7850c.voiceContent: A dog? You can determine their mood just by looking at their wagging tail, right?

ac759f4602803dac.voiceContent: At first glance, this camp seems organized along arbitrary lines. But on closer inspection, the underlying principles become clear. I would even say they are rather inspiring.

b19c0d6bf562fbcb.voiceContent: Hm, to make things easier for you, I will take responsibility for the most difficult part... playing and interacting with it.

b2c5397d9fe3b325.voiceContent: I have no experience in this matter. I'm not entirely sure if I'm qualified to be a pet's master.

b349cb78da011786.voiceContent: Whenever I think about it, I can only conclude that I have no time to care for a pet. Please, forget that I ever mentioned it.

b8ab6ca8e9d19b8e.voiceContent: To be honest, I've been studying methods of discourse lately in hopes of altering my stern appearance.

c01324b37f7e0d77.voiceContent: Going to bed at this hour? Perhaps there is something on your mind?

c03e61666de2aec3.voiceContent: So everything here was built according to your designs? I did not know you possessed such abilities.

c1549b34f5b6ed7a.voiceContent: Either way, in accordance with established military convention, those who demonstrate outstanding capabilities ought to be rewarded.

ca6435030eed0275.voiceContent: But I should remind you that I've never viewed you as a subordinate.

ca7bdf8b223a7ca8.voiceContent: Hah, I suppose you are right.

d018f454bf5a6545.voiceContent: Maintaining an orderly residence incentivizes us to adhere also to the rules that give order to our lives.

eac136caf95ee490.voiceContent: If so, there is no harm in telling me. If not, then all the better. There's no reason for you to worry needlessly.

f554cc52be92222c.voiceContent: What's the matter? Are you unwilling to assist?

f7d67fa764b57298.voiceContent: Exactly. You will be responsible for feeding and cleaning up after it. That's all.

794169b0e89a2706.voiceContent: Remove all threats to Eternity — by order of the Almighty Shogun.

02f19ddf9d900263.voiceContent: I lead a relatively simple life when I'm not leading an army into battle. I always get out of bed at 505 on the dot. Then I go to the courtyard where I take five deep breaths before walking five laps around it. For breakfast, I typically eat five mouthfuls... Five is my lucky number, so I do things in fives. Do you have some objection to that?

06033834e2cbdcc6.voiceContent: Good evening. You know, in Hanamizaka, the sight of the Sakura by night is quite splendid. I never tire of it.

0894383b22e25f91.voiceContent: No general can win all battles... I have to admit, that was an excellent show of skill.

0b7a88281e26133d.voiceContent: Listen. Thunder speaks the will of the Almighty Shogun.

0d38ac5e3a55bd1b.voiceContent: I will lead us to victory.

122cf1dd2c90a9e4.voiceContent: So, there is a dish that tastes even better than Onigiri? Then I shall be sure to remember its name.

13bcde7503043608.voiceContent: Power duly assimilated. Ready to receive instruction.

19bf2a6bc1ac57a8.voiceContent: That was a fine duel indeed. If you wouldn't mind, shall we play a few more matches?

1bc2fa01b984af6c.voiceContent: As I'm sure you've heard many times before, the Almighty Shogun seeks Eternity — an existence beyond the dominion of thought and longing. Abandon mortal ties, strive for an unchanging Eternity... The Almighty Shogun's manner is always resolute, and I do not always fully grasp the meaning of her words. But this is her decision, and I trust her.

1dd7a061b736168a.voiceContent: As long as she is not setting off fireworks in my camp, I will cause her no trouble. Heh, yes, I know — all else aside, her fireworks are spectacular and brilliant, and she deserves all the praise she gets. The issue for me is that fireworks are fleeting in nature. After one brief moment of dazzling light, all that remains is the pitch-black night sky, the same as before. So I often have to caution myself not to become too captivated by this illusory spectacle. It is transient, but Inazuma is eternal, and my mission is to protect Inazuma.

21ef5d3aa104490f.voiceContent: My aspirations? I thought you already knew To assist the Almighty Shogun in manifesting Eternity. That is what I aspire to. Hmm? Personal aspirations? It's not something I have ever thought about before...

2abd2e7521df985e.voiceContent: Though you present an unstable factor in the Almighty Shogun's Eternity, unstable does not have to mean a threat. So I am not your enemy — but I will be watching you at all times.

2bedc3be8fa079d4.voiceContent: What a magnificent victory. Heh, I should practice more when time permits... I'll challenge you to a rematch in due course.

35b1a2fd7a472565.voiceContent: I generally avoid sweet foods, not that I have a strong aversion to them. Why? Well, sweet things put your mind and body at rest, so if I ever eat sweet things it's easy to... Ahem, essentially, I mustn't slack off and that's the end of it. No further questions on this topic!

3878f9082feea37e.voiceContent: I have eaten my fill. Thank you for your hospitality.

3a23cfc7c411bd5d.voiceContent: Tsk... I can't help but get a little irate when his name comes up. He kicked up a big fuss when I confiscated his Vision, by far the noisiest person... no, the noisiest oni I've ever encountered. He showed he was enough of a man to admit defeat, but the rematch he insisted upon... Tsk... To this day, I still don't want to talk about it. If you really must know, you can go and ask him yourself.

3c4cb516bb5768d8.voiceContent: In the Kujou household, normally the only sound to be heard is that of soldiers training in the dojo. But in the Kamisato household, there is the sound of music, dance, bickering, and laughter... I have heard that Miss Kamisato is skilled in the game of Go, and have always hoped for an occasion to pay her a visit, but... I also worry that someone of a serious demeanor like myself may not quite fit in there.

43dfeff7b5595f4c.voiceContent: You want to know more about me? ...Know what, exactly? I can't discuss Tenryou Commission business with you, that's strictly confidential, and I certainly can't divulge anything relating to the Almighty Shogun. What exactly are you trying to achieve? Hmm? Me on a personal level...? I suppose that's not out of the question, just... unprecedented.

4d5151b45aaa1da5.voiceContent: The existence of a tengu warrior's wings is an objective fact, as is the reality that they will take up a certain amount of space when standing side-by-side. So when you say come closer, I fail to see how exactly I am supposed to achieve that.

526bba8ec7f13966.voiceContent: Excellent. These spoils will boost morale.

531e44d7353c8aa4.voiceContent: To this day, not a day goes by without bow exercises and target practice. From adopting the stance, to aiming, to hearing the twang of the bowstring, none of this is dry and repetitive for me — it is about transcending the me of yesterday! I wouldn't call it a hobby so much as a lifelong discipline.

546f646c51478a5b.voiceContent: To manifest Eternity per the Almighty Shogun's will — that is what I aspire to.

5558ebe6a5ace51a.voiceContent: The thing that gave me the most trouble when enforcing the Vision Hunt Decree was those officers of the Shogun's Army who would abuse their authority to be heavy-handed with those we detained. The will of the Almighty Shogun must be executed, but I do not condone violence against innocent people! I have expressly forbidden such behavior on countless occasions but judging by the outcome, it seems difficult to root out. If you have any ideas on how to tackle it, please share them with me.

5c28cc2bec616af7.voiceContent: A duel? I had the same intention in mind. Let us begin at once.

5eb25709880397bd.voiceContent: ...The battle is still far from over.

60dedb4e48df8ac6.voiceContent: The sound of rain masks the enemy's footsteps. Stay alert.

6287d1dddb9dfed3.voiceContent: Can a game like this really be relaxing? I'm not convinced it's conducive to work-life balance.

6684e6bf144989d0.voiceContent: Guuji Yae's actions often leave me with many questions... Nevertheless, the fact that she is the head shrine maiden of the Grand Narukami Shrine clearly shows the level of trust and approval that the Shogun places in her, and for this reason I also greatly respect her. But... if there ever comes a day when she disobeys the Shogun's will, then please accept my apologies in advance.

67254bf6fd74b473.voiceContent: Am I ready to depart? Let me put it to you like this. If you were to make a habit of asking me this question every time before you move out, you would find that you only receive an answer from me one time out of 10. The other nine times, I would already be fighting fiercely on the front line. Not because I am foolhardy, nor because I lack courtesy, but because the battle never waits till you are ready.

678d005b053aea65.voiceContent: Recently, I often feel a mysterious gaze from the shadows that disappears as soon as I turn to look. What an absurd prank... Huh? A nekomata, you say? Huh... She should've just come right up to me if she needed something.

6a46fd77020c5c48.voiceContent: The skies are clear and the sun is bright. Fine weather for a showdown.

6bdbfdc996a2232e.voiceContent: Go and rest. I will stay here and keep watch.

715a2ccfcaee6e1e.voiceContent: During a previous assignment, a vendor in Hanamizaka gifted me a kind of spinning top called the Solo. It's a toy that you can play with when you're by yourself. I was quite taken with it, so I kept it. ...You want to play with it together? But that would defy the principle on which the Solo is based... Respectfully, I must decline.

72a571572a6d9e6b.voiceContent: She is more proficient as a military strategist than a priestess. The way she uses directives to wage war is almost unheard of. I wonder if I should adopt this technique for commanding the Shogun's Army? Hmm... but this could lead us to a situation whereby war is waged at the negotiation table, each side with their pack of strategy cards, playing them one by one until a victor emerges... Then again, perhaps not.

7461f92c8d7f8ee1.voiceContent: Shikanoin and I may be colleagues, but I have few positive words to say about him. He seems preoccupied with his personal schemes while official duties take second place. The only reason I have not sought to bring him into line so far is that his investigations deliver results... n*sigh* He is such a headache.

7698aa1055dfa611.voiceContent: Although I was fully adopted by the Kujou Clan, I know that Takayuki does not look at me the same way he looks at Kamaji. I might be a little stone-faced sometimes, but even I get lonely... especially when I catch sight of one of my subordinates sharing an intimate moment with their family. ...nI'm sorry, I have nothing but gratitude for Takayuki. How could I be so disrespectful...

775239f855bcc986.voiceContent: I am Kujou Sara. You may forget my name, but this you must know On my watch, Inazuma will always be defended, and the will of the Shogun will always be done. Deity or demon, if you make an enemy of me you will be struck down! Oh, ahem... Don't be so nervous. I have agreed to fight by your side, and I will honor that commitment. I may be uncompromising on matters of great importance, but on most other things, you will find me quite easygoing.

80b5b501de93ef0c.voiceContent: Good morning...? You mean you only just got out of bed? This is already quite late by my standards. I typically rise well before daybreak.

861727e72dbbfc03.voiceContent: So, the Vision Hunt Decree was repealed... Yes, it seems that you were right. ...Ahem, but this is not to say that the Almighty Shogun made a mistake. She has simply chosen to pursue eternity by a different route. I do not know whether the Shogun has finally found inner peace after protecting Inazuma over all these millennia. All I know is that however perilous the road ahead may become, I will follow her as I have always done.

86d6de4366424210.voiceContent: It all comes down to being an experienced warrior.

885f3c7d5357ad01.voiceContent: When I confiscated people's Visions, I trampled on their ambitions. Now that the Vision Hunt Decree has been repealed, I must atone for my actions. I am led to believe that you can hear those ambitions...The ones echoing within the Visions embedded on the Statue of the Omnipresent God? I'd like you to tell me more about them. Also... your own ambitions, I would like to hear about those as well.

97c959220df312a8.voiceContent: I am not in the habit of resting at noon. But if you wish to do so, I will wait for you.

a04cba444ae3abf2.voiceContent: The responsibility for honing my strength and advancing my martial abilities lies with me, and yet you have so diligently and willingly helped me... I will become worthy of this power by harnessing it for a higher cause! Also... the favor of the tengu will always be with you!

a91e20f3fb224081.voiceContent: Excellent timing. I will dispense with the formalities and get straight to the point — do you have a birthday wish? Providing that it does not conflict with the Almighty Shogun's grand cause, I will make every effort to see it come to fruition. To show that I am being completely serious, I will allow you to make not one, but five birthday wishes.

bac667efc41a7fc1.voiceContent: With her talent and qualifications, it's a shame she decided to join the Arataki gang. I must concede, however, that at the very least, her presence has effectively prevented idlers from stirring up trouble and disturbing the public, reducing the burden on the Tenryou Commission.

bb4cbc65b03937ee.voiceContent: So, there is a dish that tastes even better than Onigiri? Then I shall be sure to remember its name.

bcfaa8e58646c84d.voiceContent: Gorou is to Sangonomiya Kokomi as I am to the Raiden Shogun. He is fiercely loyal, and I have great respect for this. It's a shame we're on opposing sides, so we'll never get to work together... Still, I am glad to have an admirable foe. Also... I hear he's a fifth-born son. That just makes it even better.

c18c786dfb166cc9.voiceContent: The Shogun's Army might as well just be me!

c2afe897943d7ec9.voiceContent: Good. Leave nothing of value behind.

c47773df8e341414.voiceContent: I have eaten my fill. Thank you for your hospitality.

c94f26a883ff5dd1.voiceContent: I am grateful to Takayuki. The Tenryou Commission is all I've ever had to rely on, and I will do everything within my power to defend my family's honor. Hmm? You want to know about the Tenryou Commission's code of conduct? Loyalty to the Raiden Shogun, of course! That is also my life's creed.

cb953ad7f981a7c1.voiceContent: Do you know what the most distinctively Inazuman item of all is? No, it is not a blade of any sort. It is a lacquerware carving of the Statue of Her Excellency, the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, God of Thunder. They are hand-made by old and skilled lacquerware craftspeople, and nearly every single home in the city has one. My house, you ask? I have five.

ce41d62b3468cc9e.voiceContent: You may have won the battle, but I shall win the war.

cf6b0a3cdee99240.voiceContent: I'll give it my all, so don't hold back.

d10ecbe77bed88d0.voiceContent: Are you leaving? Yeah, it's about time for me to go, too... I've taken enough time out for one day.

d13fb47965c58b1a.voiceContent: There still has to be a way forward.

d27af27494780112.voiceContent: The duty of a tengu warrior is to watch over the mountains and forests, while that of the Kujou Clan is to guard Inazuma. These two are of the same ilk.

d305ac5ceb6a524f.voiceContent: My bow sounds in peak condition. One shot is all I need.

d70b168641dd87e4.voiceContent: To strike your foe takes unity between mind, arrow, and bow.

d870bfd158abe7cd.voiceContent: Only if the gods cast their gaze upon you will you receive a Vision. Since my own Vision was granted by the Almighty Shogun, I shall return it to her in the end, without hesitation and with no regrets.

de64c7097dc74db9.voiceContent: I would like to catch a snowflake, but once you have them in the palm of your hand, they melt away all the more quickly.

e8e9edd6a50744aa.voiceContent: The Tenryou Commission's estate is very large. It would serve us well to have a fine housekeeper like Thoma who could keep all the numerous and disparate household affairs in order. If he ever tires of working for the Kamisato Clan, I would very much like for him to come to us... though I doubt that day will ever come.

f4db5018993f8890.voiceContent: Now that I think about it, you and I are a good example of achieving concord through conflict. We were on opposite sides — diametrically opposed, you could say. I never imagined I would end up alongside you, either in battle or in long conversation... Fate has been kind to me, no, sorry, ignore that.

facea2fb0bfe0efb.voiceContent: I have always had a preference for easy-to-carry foods that provide quick and ample sustenance, such as Onigiri. The top choice for replenishing your stamina in the middle of a battle! But that's just a personal preference. I don't dictate what my subordinates have to eat.

fc0e9c41965976d8.voiceContent: Whenever something is bothering me inside, I stand beneath the Sacred Sakura, close my eyes, and try to calm my mind. When I open my eyes again, the falling blossoms will guide my path.
